criteria: Analysis of the Interplay Between Internal and External Issues
descriptions: The student does not identify any internal issues related to seeking mental health assistance.
The student identifies one vague or unclear internal issue related to seeking mental health assistance.
The student identifies one specific internal issue related to seeking mental health assistance but lacks detail.
The student identifies two specific internal issues related to seeking mental health assistance with some detail.
The student identifies three specific internal issues related to seeking mental health assistance and provides clear explanations for each.
The student comprehensively identifies and explains multiple relevant internal issues, demonstrating a deep understanding of how these issues affect seeking mental health assistance.
The student does not identify any external issues related to seeking mental health assistance.
The student identifies one vague or unclear external issue related to seeking mental health assistance.
The student identifies one specific external issue related to seeking mental health assistance but lacks detail.
The student identifies two specific external issues related to seeking mental health assistance with some detail.
The student identifies three specific external issues related to seeking mental health assistance and provides clear explanations for each.
The student comprehensively identifies and explains multiple relevant external issues, demonstrating a deep understanding of how these issues affect seeking mental health assistance.
The student fails to analyze the interplay between internal and external issues related to seeking mental health assistance.
The student attempts to analyze the interplay between internal and external issues, but the analysis is superficial or unclear.
The student briefly mentions the interplay between internal and external issues but lacks depth.
The student provides a basic analysis of how internal and external issues may interact when seeking mental health assistance.
The student provides a detailed analysis of how internal and external issues interact, including specific examples.

The student provides a sophisticated analysis of the complex interplay between internal and external issues, demonstrating a nuanced understanding of the challenges in seeking mental health assistance.
